title: (x) Common videogame font - Reishotai (?) {Aleph Langley}
content:
Here's a font I see in Videgames, I think there's also a Japanese version of the font, but I have no idea who makes it or what it's called, any ideas?   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085740im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24786.gif)   
   
(Sorry for the subject name -- I couldn't think of what to title it, heh)
author: toketsu

comments.content:
Could you please give us some more background information?   
Is that a screen font in videogames? For which gaming system?

Uhm, It's used in (some) Japanese games for English text. I ripped it off the disc from Persona 2: TSUMI for PlayStation. It's also used in the English version of Resident Evil 0 for GameCube, might also be in the remake of Resident Evil for GameCube. I think I've also seen it used in some pictures from Japanese websites. That's all I know.

hmm, according to the back of my Resident Evil 0 box -- "The Typefaces included herein are soley developed by DynaComware"....   
   
I checked that site, but uh, can't seem to find the specific font.

Ok, found it... But, it seems it can only be bought from Japanese sites, ugh.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085740im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24959.gif)
Do you happen to have the name of the font, so I can credit the ID?
And which Japanese site(s) it's available from?

Don't have the english name, only the Kanji -- Kanji I can't really read, so, I lack the name.   
   
 [http://www.vector.co.jp/swreg/catalogue/dynalab/truetype\_win04.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085740/http:/www.vector.co.jp/swreg/catalogue/dynalab/truetype_win04.html)
